revised_title: New Discoveries in the Synthesis and Reactions of Glycol Derivatives
tldr: The author, Maxwell Simpson, discovered new methods for synthesizing glycol derivatives, including chloracetine and butyroacetate of glycol. He also studied the reactions of these compounds with various reagents, such as hydrochloric acid, potassium hydroxide, and silver acetate. Simpson's work expanded the understanding of glycol chemistry and laid the foundation for further research in the field.
